poem:
### Divvying Shadows

In Alaska's cold expanse,  
two giants whisper over crumpled maps,  
divvying shadows of a fractured land.  
The winds, indifferent to their deals,  
carry the cries of distant souls.  
Hope cowers beneath icy veils  
while leaders barter futures,  
threads of integrity pulled thin  
in the silent grip of frost.
